parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To cause to take root; met: I plant, fix firmly, establish. From rhiza; to root.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To build upon (above) a foundation. From epi and oikodomeo; to build upon, i.e. to rear up.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To confirm, ratify, secure, establish; pass: I guarantee. From bebaios; to stabilitate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From perissos; to superabound, be in excess, be superfluous; also to cause to superabound or excel.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Thankfulness, gratitude; giving of thanks, thanksgiving. From eucharistos; gratitude; actively, grateful language.
